string 1:
When Extra Strikes triggers, a circle will appear on the HUD.

{fc9Press {decision} when the circle reaches the center to cause a "Strike Effect."}

Strike Effects have a variety of additional effects such as healing allies
or inflicting status abnormalities on enemies.

{fc9The effects vary depending on Digimon attribute and Personality.}
Try out different combinations to use in battle.

Attack compatibility can be confirmed during target selection,
where {fc9damage output in %} will be displayed along with
{fc9corresponding arrow icons} to indicate effects based on Attributes,
Elements, and Traits.

You can also view an enemy's compatibility details via {fc9{l2} Analyze}.

When facing enemies with unfavorable compatibility, consider
switching to Digimon with favorable compatibility.

Detailed information on Attributes, Elements, and Traits can be
found via Digivice > System > Tutorials > Battle, under:
{fc9 - Attribute Compatibility
 - Elements
 - Traits}

A battle action which can be employed by agents.

By consuming a massive amount of energy, the agent can unleash 
powerful Cross Arts capable of changing the course of battle.

{fc9Press {r1} in battle to flee from hostile Digimon.}
There is no shame for an agent to exercise discretion in the course
of a mission.

However, fleeing constantly will gain you nothing. And there may be
enemies that you can't escape from. That is why it is also important
to gain experience for such occasions.

Balance your decisions carefully.

A battle command. Hold {up} to command your partner Digimon to guard on their turn.
{fc9Guarding greatly reduces damage until their next turn.}

Guarding is effective when you can't avoid attacks from an enemy
with unfavorable compatibility or powerful Special Skills.

A battle command that allows you to view enemy Digimon's stats.

{fc9Information such as Attribute, Element and Traits should provide
hints for determining favorable or unfavorable compatibility.}

Put Analyze to good use when planning your battle strategies.

{fc9In order to use Cross Arts, you must charge your CP (Critical Points) to the max.}

When charged to the max, you will enter a "Cross Art Standby" state.

This occurs when HP reaches zero. Digimon that have been
KO'd are incapable of combat, so you must attend to them as
soon as possible.

- Use a revival item/skill to revive the ally.
- Replace the KO'd ally with a reserved member.

KO'd Digimon are revived after the battle with only 1 HP, so
remember to heal them before proceeding.

There are two types of attacks: "physical" and "magic".

{fc9Physical attacks are effective against foes with low DEF.
For enemies with low SPI, you'll want to use magic attacks.}

Some Digimon are resistant to both physical and magic attacks.
Be sure to check your foes' characteristics as you fight.

{is28}{image(ui_icon_btlStatus_044)}: Reduces physical damage.
{is28}{image(ui_icon_btlStatus_045)}: Reduces magic damage.

Make sure to carefully review the data of your partner Digimon.

Not only will you be better able to understand their hidden powers,
but you're bound to find hints on how to better train them as well.

You might even find inspiration for some new strategies.

{fc9Digimon can also be enhanced by changing their Attachment Skills
or equipment. If you obtain any Skill Discs or equipment, be sure to
equip them.}

ATK: Affects how much {fc9{is28}{image(ui_icon_tab_0001)} physical damage} is dealt to enemies.
DEF: Affects how much {fc9{is28}{image(ui_icon_tab_0001)} damage from enemy physical attacks} is
reduced.
INT: Affects how much {fc9{is28}{image(ui_icon_tab_0002)} magic damage} is dealt to enemies.
SPI: Affects how much {fc9{is28}{image(ui_icon_tab_0002)} damage from enemy magic attacks} is
reduced and how much {fc9{is28}{image(ui_icon_tab_0003)} HP recovery skills heal}.
SPD: Affects {fc9turn order} in battle.
CRT Rate: Affects the rate at which {fc9critical hits (1.3x damage)} occur.

Defeating a Digimon in battle increases the Scan Rate of that Digimon.
When you find a Digimon you are looking for, keep on battling it.
You can check the Scan Rate of each Digimon on your 
Digivice under "Digimon > Convert."

{fc9The closer the Scan Rate is to 200% at the time of Conversion, 
the higher the new Digimon's Talent and max HP will be.}

Digimon that participate in battle are split into three categories:

{fc9Battle Members}: Digimon which enter combat at the start of battle
{fc9Reserve Members}: Digimon which you can substitue battle members
for during battle
{fc9Guest Members}: Digimon which have temporarily joined your party
and conduct battle independently

{fc9Strategize and change between battle and reserve members in order
to make effective use of enemy weaknesses.}

As Digimon gain experience, they can undergo significant changes 
to their appearance and nature that make them even stronger. 
These sudden transformations are referred to as "Digivolution."

{fc9There are certain conditions for Digivolution:
- Meet the required stats (excluding increases from equipment).
- Meet the required Agent Rank}.

Collect data on as many Digimon as possible and use it to uncover 
new Digivolution results.

Conversely, the process of compressing a 
Digimon's data is referred to as "De-Digivolution."
This is an effective means of Digivolving a 
particular Digimon into a different specimen.

{fc9One of the following conditions must be met in 
order to De-Digivolve a Digimon:
- The resulting De-Digivolution Digimon is 
registered in your Field Guide, or
- The resulting De-Digivolution Digimon is 
of the same Personality.}

There are secret techniques for Digivolution and De-Digivolution.

Navigate to System > Tutorial > Training on your Digivice to view:
{fc9Digivolution Technique 1: Talent,
Digivolution Technique 2: Cumulative Value, and
Digivolution Technique 3: Bond.}

Your partner Digimon are capable of equipping "Attachment Skills,"
allowing you to change their abilities at will.

{fc9Up to 4 skills can be equipped using "Skill Discs."}

Skill Discs can be obtained in a variety of ways, such as purchasing
them in shops, finding them in treasure chests, or gaining them
when your Digimon level up.

Set your Digimon's Attachment Skills by navigating your Digivice
to Digimon > Setup > {sub2} Show Stats/Skills, then selecting a slot
under Attachment Skills.

{fc9Attachment Skills (Skills Discs) can be removed and re-equipped
to other Digimon.}

Use Attachment Skills to compensate for weaknesses, to further
enhance strengths, or to counter compatibility issues.

"Equipment" consists of upgrade patches which enhance your
Digimon's capabilities.

Set your Digimon's Equipment by navigating your Digivice to
Digimon > Setup > {sub2} Show Stats/Skills, then selecting a slot
under Equipment.

{fc9Equipment can be removed and re-equipped to other Digimon.}

Equipment can be obtained in a variety of ways, such as purchasing
them in shops or finding them in treasure chests. There are also
rumors of equipment that can only be obtained from particular
Digimon.

This is an important factor that determines a Digimon's development.
Personality type determines which stats are more likely to receive
an increase.

Valor: {fc9ATK} increases easily, physical attacker type.
Amicability: {fc9DEF} increases easily, supporter type.
Philanthropy: {fc9SPI} increases easily, healer type.
Wisdom: {fc9INT} increases easily, magic attacker type.

{fc9To check Personality, display "Digimon Personality Type" using
{sub2} Toggle Info while the Digimon's status is open.}

Personality type influences a Digimon in several ways.

{fc9- It makes certain stats grow more.
- It changes the types of Personality Skills.
- It changes the impact of Strike Effect.}

Decide your Digimon's Personality type according to the direction
you wish to develop it in.

A Digimon's initial Personality type is determined when it's Converted.

Which Personality type a Digimon will be born with is unknown, but
there seems to be a certain trend for each Digimon type.

{fc9Personality types can also be changed afterward.}
Every Digimon has a unique Personality.

{fc9The Personality type of partner Digimon can be changed.}

Personality will change bit by bit via training on the Digifarm, or
depending on the content of your conversations or Digiline
interactions with the partner Digimon.

Though this takes time, your active communication is essential when
aiming to change Personalities.

Personality Skills are passive skills tied to the partner Digimon's
Personality type.

Some Personality Skills bring about various effects depending on
Personality type.

{fc9You can check a partner Digimon's Personality Skill in its stats.}

Partner Digimon are capable of changing their Personality Skill.

In this situation, the partner Digimon will get an idea for a Personality
Skill and ask if it should make a change.

{fc9You should decide whether the Digimon keeps its current Personality
Skill or changes to the new one that it has suggested.}

Unfortunately, there will be times when you must say farewell
to your partner Digimon.

In order to do so, select "Return to Data" to return the Digimon
to its underlying data and convert it into funds.

{fc9Note that you'll permanently lose any Digimon that you
return to data.} Make sure to be careful when using this feature.

This feature allows you to transfer one Digimon's data to another
through synthesis.

{fc9The resource data (material) Digimon will be converted into EXP to
be absorbed by the base data Digimon. A portion of its Talent and
cumulative stats will also be inherited.}

The source Digimon will be converted into data to be passed on to
the next Digimon.

Bond is a numerical representation of your relationship with your
partner Digimon.

Bond increases slightly over the course of your adventures with
the Digimon.

{fc9The higher a Digimon's Bond, the more times it is able to
inherit a cumulative stat when Digivolving and De-Digivolving,
thereby boosting its stats (up to 100 times max). Additionally,
Bond does not decrease with De-Digivolution.}

How to Increase a Digimon's Bond

- Participate in battles.
- Talk to partner Digimon.
- Feed the Digimon at the farm.

Talent is a numerical representation of a Digimon's level limit.

{fc9A Digimon's Talent increases upon Digivolving, and increases
even further when frequently participating in battle. Furthermore,
Talent does not decrease when Digivolving or De-Digivolving.}

Therefore, it is possible to develop even more powerful Digimon
through repeated Digivolution and De-Digivolution.

How to Increase a Digimon's Talent

- Participate in battles.
- Finish off an enemy.
- Strike an enemy's weak point.
- Win a battle without taking damage.
- Train at the farm.

ADAMAS assigns a numerical value known as Anomaly Points to
help visualize the EXP that agents earn when completing missions. 

{fc9These points are needed to learn Agent Skills.}

Therefore, gain as much experience as possible with your Digimon
in order to develop your abilities even further.

This system lets agents use Anomaly Points to expand their abilities 
and enhance their partner Digimon.

{fc9Bonds of Loyalty}: Expands an agent's abilities and enhances all
Digimon.
{fc9Bonds of Valor}: Enhances Digimon with Valor-type personalities.
{fc9Bonds of Philanthropy}: Enhances Digimon with Philanthropy-type
personalities.
{fc9Bonds of Amicability}: Enhances Digimon with Amicability-type
personalities.
{fc9Bonds of Wisdom}: Enhances Digimon with Wisdom-type
personalities.

Learn Agent Skills in order to boost your capabilities.

This is a numerical representation of an agent's career and skill level.

{fc9Your Agent Rank increases the more you use Anomaly Points
to learn Agent Skills.} 

Your Agent Rank is linked to a number of different features, such as:
- Agent Skill effect amplification.
- Partner Digimon Digivolution conditions.

Keep working to constantly boost your rank.

{fc9You can use "Agent Skill: Bonds of Loyalty" to learn Cross Art effects.}

Change between the Cross Art effects you have learned by going to: 
Agent > Cross Art Settings on your Digivice.

It's a good idea to select your Cross Art effects based on your 
agent's battle strategy.

Make contact with a hostile Digimon, and you will enter battle.

While it can be harsh and unforgiving, the experience obtained in
battle is essential. From helping develop your partner Digimon, to
increasing Scan Rates for Digimon Conversion, battle is key to
overcoming the challenges that await you on your mission.

Actively engage in battles and grow strong, Agent.

{fc9Skill attacks used by partner Digimon during DigiAttacks reflect the
skill's damage and element effects.}

The most effective partner Digimon attack is automatically selected.

{fc9DigiAttack skill attacks do not consume SP,} so use them aggressively
in order to start the battle with an advantage.

{fc9Some objects must be hit with DigiAttacks featuring skill attacks
of certain elements.}

If your attacks are failing, try making a change to your partner
Digimon's Attachment Skills.

You can obtain items that are useful for completing your mission.

Treasure Chests
These contain Support Items that can be used only by agents.

Materials
Specific locations let you procure materials and other items.

{fc9Use Analyze Mode to help detect and locate these.} If you find
one, make sure to collect its contents.

Digimon that are capable of DigiRide will have a ride icon on the
Setup screen.
Try DigiRiding different Digimon as you collect them.

This is an auto-recovery program for your partner Digimon.

{fc9The program boots up when you're standing still and restores your
Digimon's HP and SP.}

Whenever you find a safe location, be sure to use this program to
recuperate before returning to your mission.

This mode lets your Digivice display various kinds of information 
that cannot be seen with the naked eye alone.

{fc9- See which objects can be targeted with a DigiAttack.
- View details regarding a hostile Digimon (use {sub2}).
- Search for treasure chests and materials.}

While in Analyze Mode, you can perform 
DigiAttacks on hostile Digimon and objects.

Your current objective will be displayed as a 
guide marker on the map.

This database features info on Digimon that you have come into
contact with and is found under Agent > Field Guide on your Digivice.

{fc9Digimon Discovered}
Digimon that you have defeated in battle or with DigiAttacks. Most
of the details remain unidentified.

{fc9Registered Digimon}
Digimon that you have partnered with. You can also view detailed
info such as their profiles.

Your primary mission, deemed critical priority under orders from
ADAMAS. Failure to complete the mission may result in the end
of the world as we know it.

Agent, be sure to conduct your mission with utmost care.

Messages containing useful information such as tutorials and
mission intel will be sent to your Digivice.
{fc9You can view previously received messages via Digiline on your
Digivice.}

These are mysterious phenomena with no scientific explanation.
Minor explosions and shockwaves of unknown origin have been
reported, as well as strange lifeforms, regional earthquakes and
other unusual weather patterns.

Research conducted by ADAMAS has shown that the frequency of
these anomalous phenomena coincides with an increase in social
unrest. Over the past few years, the phenomena have been
increasing at a rapid rate, which has happened a handful of times
throughout history. Each time, the events caused society to fall into
chaos and eventually led to an epidemic, disaster or all-out war.

An organization working behind the scenes to deal with the bizarre
phenomena known as "anomalies."

Dispatching its agents on missions all across the globe and
collecting and analyzing information for its massive database,
ADAMAS exists to protect the world from the anomalies that
traditional government organizations cannot handle. Apart from
its headquarters, it is rumored to have branches scattered across
different regions. However, under the directive of its founder to
remain covert, much of its true nature remains hidden in secrecy.

Digimon are mysterious beings with a strong correlation to areas
where anomalous phenomena have been sighted. Although
ADAMAS has been investigating these beings for many years,
we still know very little. Until recently, we could only describe
them as what people call "phantoms." Lately, however, the
organization has bolstered its research efforts in response to a
sudden increase in Digimon sightings over the years. Digimon
were found to be "electronic lifeforms," with characteristics of
both organic matter and electric signals. It's believed that they're
the source of the anomalous phenomena.

This special device was developed by ADAMAS and contains a
unique "summoning program" that utilizes a Digimon's electronic
data. These devices are given to agents and allow them to convert
the aspect of Digimon that corresponds to genes into electronic
data made up of ones and zeros. And even though Digimon are
organic lifeforms as well, they can also be "copied" because of this
data if certain conditions are met.

This general theory was the work of Dr. Yuki, who was the
original founder of ADAMAS. He apparently referred to these
phase electron lifeforms as "semi-cyber beings." Although
his theories were largely ignored in academic circles, the
members of the organization continued his research, thus
leading to the creation of the Digivice.

As one of the organization's founders, Dr. Yuki
developed numerous inventions that were useful
to society. And yet, few people know about him,
due in large part to his personality. He rarely
showed himself in public, and he transferred all
rights to his work to the government and large
corporations, using the proceeds to establish
ADAMAS. Today, his original mission of defending
society from the threat of the anomalies lives
on through the organization's current members.

It's believed that the organization's secrecy is due to its desire
to prevent its analysis of the anomalies from falling into the
wrong hands. As a result, the organization keeps its activities
shrouded in secrecy, so as to protect its research from being
misused by entities such as the military industrial complex.

Your offensive options may also possess an elemental affinity.

 - Attack: a normal attack without elemental affinity.
 - Skill: an ability which may have an elemental affinity.

{fc9Damage is increased when the attack is of a target's elemental
weakness, and damage is reduced when against a target's
elemental resistance.}

Simply look at the damage output display when selecting a
target to view an attack's compatibility.

Each Digimon possesses Traits which are based on their type and
characteristics. Certain special skills are effective against specific
Traits, resulting in{fc9 1.5x damage dealt}.

{fc9You can view the Traits of enemy Digimon via {l2} Analyze during
battle.}

Turn Order during battle is determined by each Digimon's SPD stat.
Turn Order is recalculated when SPD changes for any Digimon.

{fc9Using skills and items to alter the SPD of your allies and enemies in
order to manipulate the Turn Order is a key battle strategy.}

{fc9When an attack has favorable compatibility, it will strike the
enemy's "weak point." Compatibility is determined via Attributes,
Elements, and Traits.}

Additionally, other effects such as from a Digimon's Personality
Skill can also have a large influence on attack compatibility.

There are hints in a Digimon's stats and other details for finding
compatibilities and weak points, so be sure to use Analyze Mode
to find them.

These are a Digimon's unique set of skills, capable of dealing large
amounts of damage or triggering certain effects.

Some Digimon even have a Special Skill that lets them initiate a
Mode Change.

Getting a grasp on these Special Skills is key to unlocking each
Digimon's potential in battle.

These are powerful skills used between specific Digimon.
{fc9DNA Digivolution Skills appear in eligible Digimon's skill selection
menus in battle.}

These skills will only become available once you have met the
necessary conditions:
 - Both DNA Digivolution-capable Digimon are battle members; and
 - Both DNA Digivolution-capable Digimon can act on their turn.

It is an Agent's duty to find Digimon that can combine for DNA
Digivolution Skills.

{fc9When an enemy spots and triggers an encounter, a battle will begin
with a preemptive strike from the enemy.}

If you can't avoid an encounter, it's recommended that you attack first
with a {r2} DigiAttack.

A battle command. Press {decision} to command your Digimon to perform
a non-elemental attack on their turn.

{fc9You can also change targets with {sub1} to attack allies as well.}
Although somewhat unusual, this tactic can be used to remove
certain status abnormalities, making it useful in some situations.

A battle command. Press {right} to command your Digimon to perform
a Special Skill or Attachment Skill on their turn.
Using a skill consumes SP (Skill Points).

Remember to keep in mind the associated element as well as timing
when using skills.

A battle command. Press {left} to support your Digimon with the use
of an item on your Digimon's turn.

{fc9Digimon do not lose their turn even if you use an item.
The Digimon will still be able to carry out another command.}

Keep items ready at all times so that your partner Digimon can fight
at full strength whenever necessary.

A battle command. Press {down} to change the current Digimon out
for a Reserve Member on their turn.
{fc9You can swap members as many times as you like during a turn.}

There appear to be certain Digimon who can transform with a 
special "Change" command. Using this command effectively can
have a large impact on the battle, making it an important part of
any strategy.

A battle command. {fc9During command selection, press {sub2} to view
information of a partner Digimon on their turn.}

It is a good idea to understand your Digimon's info so that you can
know their compatibilities with the enemy.

These items let you change your partner Digimon's Attachment Skills.

{fc9Go to Digimon > Setup on your Digivice to change Attachment Skills.}
Note: For more details, see Tutorial > Battles > Attachment Skills.

Skill Discs can be obtained in various ways, such as by finding
them in treasure chests, or by purchasing them in a shop.

The items used by an agent are categorized below.

Recovery: Recovers your partner Digimon.
Enhancement: Strengthens your partner Digimon.
Special: Sells at a high price or is used under certain conditions.
Equipment: Equips onto your partner Digimon.
Materials: Used in the Crafting Shop.
Farm: Used on the Digifarm.
Valuables: Important for conducting your missions.

These are stat changes that affect Digimon during battle.

Buffs indicate positive changes, and debuffs indicate negative ones.
{fc9Multiple effects can occur at the same time.}

Icons will be displayed next to stats affected by a buff or debuff.

This is a special status change during battle.

{fc9It prevents a Digimon from recovering HP.
The effect ends after a specified number of turns has elapsed.} 

You can also use items or skills to heal a Digimon from injuries.

This is a special status change during battle.

{fc9It prevents a Digimon from recovering SP.
The effect ends after a specified number of turns has elapsed.}

You can also help a diseased Digimon by using items or skills.

{fc9This status change occurs once a Digimon's HP falls below 30%.
The Digimon will "muster its strength" and enter Brave status.}

This status boosts ATK/INT/CRT Rate by 50% until the end of its
following turn.

This is an extremely powerful buff certain hostile Digimon possess.

{fc9Stats buffed by an enemy's Strong state will be indicated by special
colored icons. The Strong state's effects do not end based on
the passage of turns. Only a Charge Break can reset its effects.}

This is a special status change during battle.

{fc9Digimon affected keep 1 HP even if they take damage that would
normally reduce their HP to zero. (This means they can't be KO'd.)}

The Guts status can be obtained as a skill effect or other means, and
it will be marked with an icon.

It seems you've just experienced a "surprise encounter." It's rumored
that upon such an encounter, a certain Digimon will unexpectedly
appear and join the battle.

{fc9Defeat this Digimon and it will drop rare items, but it's apparently
pretty quick to retreat.} I'm sure it's only a matter of time before an
agent uncovers the truth.
Digimon Who Have Appeared during Surprise Encounters #1
Digimon Who Have Appeared during Surprise Encounters #2
Digimon Who Have Appeared during Surprise Encounters #3
Digimon Who Have Appeared during Surprise Encounters #4

When a Digimon Digivolves or De-Digivolves, the cumulative stats
are the value of the stats passed on to the next Digimon.

{fc9They are indicated by a blue number in parentheses in the Digimon's
stats.}

Cumulative stats don't decrease even if the Digimon Digivolves
or De-Digivolves. However, there is a limit to how many
times they can be carried over.
See "Digivolution Technique 3: Bond" for more information.

Increasing Cumulative Stats:

{fc9- Using Enhancement Items
Depending on the enhancement item used, the value added to a
particular stat will also be added to its cumulative stat.

- Performing Digivolution/De-Digivolution
When undergoing Digivolution or De-Digivolution, 10% of the previous
Digimon's stat value increased through leveling up or by training on
the farm will be added to the cumulative stat.}

{fc9Paralysis}
The Digimon may not be able to move during its turn. It will
automatically recover after several turns, or it can recover
immediately by using items or skills.

{fc9Immobilization}
The Digimon will be unable to move during its turn. It will
automatically recover after several turns, or it can recover
immediately by using items or skills.

{fc9Sleep}
The Digimon is unable to move. It will automatically wake up 
after several turns or after being attacked, or when items or 
skills are used on it.

{fc9Deep Slumber}
The Digimon is unable to move. It must be attacked or have 
items or skills used on it to wake up.

{fc9Crystallization}
The Digimon will crystallize and will be unable to use skills. It
will heal automatically after several turns. It can heal immediately
by using items or skills.

This is a special status change during battle.

{fc9Only Digimon with the Taunting status will be targeted for attack.
(Other Digimon cannot be targeted.)} 

The Taunting status lasts for one round.
(The status will end on the next turn of the Digimon who activated it)
